intro.text:
Welcome to "Breaking the Silence", a VR narrative experience where words have power, and conversations shape your story. In this game, you step into the role of a social worker student. Tonight, you are attending a family dinner where difficult discussions will arise. When your father makes a racist remark, you must decide how to respond. 

Every choice has consequences, shown through pop up feedbacks. Explore the apartment to find interactive objects, a newspaper, a family photo or your phone, that might help you build your argument.

This game is not about winning, it is about understanding how a conversation can create change over time.

scene.text: You know they showed a report about immigrant people and they just don`t work as hard as the rest of us. Thats why they struggle and can´t afford anything

choices.text: Actually, that is not true. Studies show that there is discrimination in hiring and also a big economic gab between or social classes.
Dad, remember when our neighbour Amir struggled to find a job despite being highly qualified? I am sure you know as well as me that that was not because he did not work hard enough
You know, that’s actually a really ignorant thing to say, it sounds kinda racist and feeds into harmful stereotypes.

scene.text: Well, I just think people should stop playing the victim.

choices.text: Right! And the next time someone cheats on a game, I won't complain, I will just play harder and pretend the rules were fair.
It is not about playing the victim. Enough studies have shown that applicants with immigrant-sounding names get up to 50% fewer callbacks for jobs.
That is exactly the kind of thinking that keeps racism alive.
Dad how would you feel being called lazy just based on where you are from?
